summary: Why do you think Aegon is Sansa's Targaryen suitor, not Jon ?
question: Why do you think Aegon is Sansa's Targaryen suitor, not Jon ?
answer:
I got this a while ago, but I guess I’ll answer. I just don’t see Jon and Sansa being a thing in the books. I think Jon is 100% dying at the end of the series, along with Dany. I get the impression Jon is going to be a “revenant” he’s returning to the world with a specific purpose. Once that’s over I think he’s dying. 

I just don’t see Sansa’s story tied up with Jon’s, nothing in the book really hints at that. Jon’s on a magical quest to save the world. I don’t see Sansa being apart of that. What the books do hint at is Sansa choosing her own marriage, becoming a Queen, and ending up breaking with Little Finger. 

The show paired Jon and Sansa together in a way that I don’t see happening in the books. I doubt Sansa and Jon will be together for any battle or travel the North together or do any of the things they did. J0nsa’s might hate me for saying this (cause I know you guys follow me, and I don’t hate you guys FYI) but I just don’t see Jon and Sansa becoming romantic in the books. It just doesn’t seem like what’s going to happen. Plus Martin can’t write romance for shit, we’re supposed to believe Dany and Drogo are romantic for gods sakes. Martin’s talented but he isn’t without his faults. I just don’t want a romance story written by him. He’s not talented at it. 

Again I might be killed for saying it, but I really don’t like the implication that Sansa is a prize for the male hero of the story. Even if that hero is Jon. Sansa being a prize doesn’t sit well with me considering all the tropes she breaks. 

As for Aegon, well I think Tourney at Ashford theory is a good one. I’ve seen some J0nsa fans try to apply it to her and Jon but it doesn’t work. The theory relies on names, not whether or not they actually are of that family. 

Ashford knights go: 

  • Baratheon
  • Tyrell 
  • Lannister 
  • Hardyng 
  • Targaryen 

Joffrey isn’t a real Baratheon, but his last name is Baratheon. Even if we get a “Jon is a legit Targaryen” he’s always going to be Jon Snow to readers. I just don’t see this theory applying to Jon. Aegon might not also be a “real” Targaryen he might actually be a Blackfyre. I think it might be slightly poetic if the first and last are actually pretenders. I think that’s a clue Martin might drop as well. 

I can certainly see Aegon becoming one of Sansa’s suitors at the very least. The marriage doesn’t necessarily have to happen. I tend to think that when Sansa finally kills Little Finger and takes the control of the 6 million crowns he stole, that she’ll be a very attractive bride. Her claims plus money would make Aegon interested. I tend to think it will be a political match, not a love match. But I also think this will be a match for Sansa’s making, something she has control over. Her latest chapter in AWOW was shocking because of how apparent it was that Sansa wants control over her marriage. So different from Sansa in AGOT, she’s not content to be a passive object anymore.

summary:
What she says: I'm fine
What she means: Sansa literally had the Northern Lords begging her to be their Queen instead of Jon and...

What she says: I'm fine
What she means: Sansa literally had the Northern Lords begging her to be their Queen instead of Jon and she refused and yet people STILL think she will betray Jon in S8.

tags: trying to see the logic in anti accusations and coming up very short
summary: I've never understood the "spoiled" and "entitled" accusations always thrown at Sansa from book and show fans alike. Entitled to...
body:
I’ve never understood the “spoiled” and “entitled” accusations always thrown at Sansa from book and show fans alike. Entitled to what? A loving marriage? Oh, no, what a…. brat? Why shouldn’t she want or expect love like almost every human being? (As opposed to a certain bastard who felt insulted by the completely honorable promotion to steward, because he’s “too good” for that servant’s job and he’s used to expecting better treatment?)

And spoiled? How? Sansa’s the one who is expected to follow the rules- and is never once praised for that. Ned is angry she attends court, which the future Queen of Westeros SHOULD be doing, and he indulges Ary.a and Bra.n for breaking the rules. Sansa’s not the one getting away with murder here. Am I to see her as spoiled because Mordane, Cat and Jeyne think highly of her? Why? She deserves it. She’s a sweet girl who works hard at her studies. Jo.n, Ary.a, Rob.b and Bra.n are well likes too yet I don’t see them getting called that.

reblog.comment:

(As opposed to a certain bastard who felt insulted by the completely honorable promotion to steward, because he’s “too good” for that servant’s job and he’s used to expecting better treatment?)

And spoiled? How? Sansa’s the one who is expected to follow the rules- and is never once praised for that. Jo.n, Ary.a, Rob.b and Bra.n are well likes too yet I don’t see them getting called that.

(As opposed to a certain bastard who felt insulted by the completely honorable promotion to steward, because he’s “too good” for that servant’s job and he’s used to expecting better treatment?)

And spoiled? How? Sansa’s the one who is expected to follow the rules- and is never once praised for that. Ned is angry she attends court, which the future Queen of Westeros SHOULD be doing, and he indulges Ary.a and Bra.n for breaking the rules. Sansa’s not the one getting away with murder here. Am I to see her as spoiled because Mordane, Cat and Jeyne think highly of her? Why? She deserves it. She’s a sweet girl who works hard at her studies. Jo.n, Ary.a, Rob.b and Bra.n are well likes too yet I don’t see them getting called that.
trail.content:
I’ve never understood the “spoiled” and “entitled” accusations always thrown at Sansa from book and show fans alike. Entitled to what? A loving marriage? Oh, no, what a…. brat? Why shouldn’t she want or expect love like almost every human being? (As opposed to a certain bastard who felt insulted by the completely honorable promotion to steward, because he’s “too good” for that servant’s job and he’s used to expecting better treatment?)

And spoiled? How? Sansa’s the one who is expected to follow the rules- and is never once praised for that. Ned is angry she attends court, which the future Queen of Westeros SHOULD be doing, and he indulges Ary.a and Bra.n for breaking the rules. Sansa’s not the one getting away with murder here. Am I to see her as spoiled because Mordane, Cat and Jeyne think highly of her? Why? She deserves it. She’s a sweet girl who works hard at her studies. Jo.n, Ary.a, Rob.b and Bra.n are well likes too yet I don’t see them getting called that.

blog.title: love forever
blog.description: love is free, let's turn forever, you and me.

tags: a song of ice and fire
summary:
"when will i wed the prince?" 
"never. you will wed the king." 
“i will be queen, though?”
